intro: Descurainia appendiculata f. tenuis, commonly known as the slender leafed tansy mustard, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, yellow flowers that typically bloom in early summer. The plant is native to North America and thrives in moist, disturbed soils such as those found in wetlands or along stream banks. It has a low-growing habit and produces slender, elongated pods that contain the seeds. This variety is notable for its distinct morphology and ecological adaptability.
